page.title: 09Leisure In South Clifton 1
page.content: There are few formal clubs within the grid for leisure time activities.There is the North and South Clifton branch of the Women's Institute which has 29 members.It meets on the 4th Tuesday of each month in the Coronation Hall South Clifton.A Youth Club ,which has a membership of around 50,meets weekly in the Sports Pavilion.It is for 7 to 15 year olds.It provides snooker,table tennis,darts and disco-dancing with outdoor games in the summer.There is also a Football team managed by Mr.R.Chapman,which plays in the local league.In summer there is also a local Cricket Team.A Riding Stables provides lessons for Local children.People who wish to indulge in other pursuits have to look elsewhere.Collingham provides a Brownie and Guide Pack.Karate lessons are available at Newark.
